title: Angola: Huíla - BNA Implements Measures to Reduce Shortage of External Revenue
text:
South Africa: Blade's Funding Crisis Denies Poor Students a Better Future Lubango — The National Reserve Bank (BNA) has been implementing since the beginning of the year 2015 several monetary and exchange measures aimed at minimising the impact of the shortage of external revenue, said last Friday in Lubango City, southern Huila Province, the Vice Governor of the BNA, Guadalberto Campos. The official made such statement when delivering a lecture on "Monetary and Exchange policy in face of the fall in external revenues", in the ambit of the Business and Investment Opportunities Forum, also dubbed Investe-Huila, which started last Friday and closed on Saturday. He informed that one of the strategies adopted by the BNA was to reduce the Overnight absorption index to zero per cent at the Monetary Policy Committee, held last February. This measure, he said, is designed to promote the grant of credit by commercial banks and improve liquidity. The BNA has also decreed the change of the Compulsory Reserves rate in national currency to 25 per cent, with 10% having been executed through the issuing of government bonds since last January. He revealed also that the Central Bank equally changed the operational rules of currency exchange bureaus, such as allowing the sale of foreign currency to tax residents up to 5000 US dollars, with a view to promoting greater transparency in the exchange market, among other measures. The forum debated themes such as international co-operation and business facilities, juridical understanding of the matter, and the economic potential of Huila Province, among other topics. Angola
